intro: Oldenlandia rupicola var. parvifolia, commonly known as the rock oldenlandia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in coastal or mountainous regions. Its leaves are usually narrow and opposite, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits. This variety is distinguished by its smaller flowers compared to the typical form of Oldenlandia rupicola.
